results.firPara: Didier Deschamps has been forced to deny he and his France team-mates disrespected the Iceland national anthem before a fixture between the teams almost 18 years ago as the sides prepare to collide once again in the quarter-finals of Euro 2016.
results.secPara: A surprised Deschamps was forced to revisit events from September 1998, when he was captain of the recently crowned world champions, on the eve of the tie at the Stade de France. Roger Lemerres French team had travelled to Laugardalsvollur in Reykjavik for their first competitive game after the World Cup and the visiting players were caught on camera laughing during the pre-match rendition of the anthems.
results.webTitle: Didier Deschamps denies France disrespected Iceland in past meeting

results.firPara: Manchester United have agreed a deal to sign the midfielder Henrikh Mkhitaryan from Borussia Dortmund, the German club have announced.
results.secPara: The 27-year-old Armenia international will become Uniteds third major summer signing under the new manager José Mourinho, following Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Eric Bailly, although the move is still to be finalised with personal terms yet to be agreed, plus a medical and work permit to be undertaken and arranged.
results.webTitle: Henrikh Mkhitaryan will join Manchester United – Borussia Dortmund

results.firPara: Supporters from all walks of life in their London outpost have descended on the Welsh Centre to witness Waless Euro 2016 dream unfold
results.secPara: Supporters from all walks of life in their London outpost have descended on the Welsh Centre to witness Waless Euro 2016 dream unfold
results.webTitle: The London Welsh Centre plays its part as fans watch shot at Euro 2016 glory

results.firPara: Dropped after defeat to Italy in Euro 2012 and sold by Bayern Munich, the striker has rediscovered his touch in Turkey and wants his share of international glory
results.secPara: As Germany went wild and celebrated winning the World Cup in Brazil two years ago, one prominent supporter of the national team experienced a wider, darker ray of emotions in their moment of triumph. When you see the team play so successfully, when youre aware of the fantastic atmosphere, you feel the pain, too, Mario Gomez admitted about watching the tournament on television. He then added But many games have been thrilling, and I was happy for the boys. It wasnt too hard [for me] during the tournament because Id had time to digest not being part of the team.
results.webTitle: Mario Gomez: the Germany scapegoat who has returned to silence his critics

results.firPara: With Iceland preparing to face hosts France in the Euro 2016 quarter-finals, three of their supporters explain the secrets behind the teams success
results.secPara: With Iceland preparing to face hosts France in the Euro 2016 quarter-finals, three of their supporters explain the secrets behind the teams success
results.webTitle: Iceland fans on Euro 2016: 'It’s turning into a nationwide romance – we're in love'

results.firPara: • We are not going to get carried away, says Wales manager
results.secPara: • We are not going to get carried away, says Wales manager
results.webTitle: Chris Coleman tells Wales to stay grounded after ‘incredible’ high

results.firPara: At Euro 2016 the Arsenal man has looked liberated, entirely sure of his role, legs constantly whizzing, a sniping, scurrying menace
results.secPara: As the clock ran down in those febrile, oddly still moments after Sam Vokess goal had confirmed what everyone in the Stade Pierre Mauroy already knew, the Welsh end lolled and bounced around like a huge, seething red-shirted basket of kittens. Wales were 3-1 up against Belgium, on their way to the semi-finals, and two games away from actually winning this tournament.
results.webTitle: Aaron Ramsey at the beating, Belgium-battering heart of Wales’s glory | Barney Ronay

results.firPara: As their heroes wrote their names in folklore, thousands of passionate fans travelled from miles around to follow the Euro 2016 action in the capital
results.secPara: Throughout the game they sang, they chanted, they screamed, they yelled. And then, at final whistle, the Welsh fans hugged and kissed. In a heaving, passionate fanzone in Cardiff, grown men and women wept openly while children laughed with joy as they celebrated one of the greatest sporting triumphs in their nations history.
results.webTitle: Cymru am byth: Cardiff fanzone roars after historic Wales victory

results.firPara: Bacary Sagna claimed Iceland gave England a lesson in dignity when eliminating Roy Hodgsons side from the European Championship as France attempt to ensure they do not suffer the same fate in Sundays quarter-final in Saint-Denis.
results.secPara: The hosts confront Lars Lagerbacks side at the Stade de France without the suspended NGolo Kanté and Adil Rami, but still as favourites to progress into a semi-final against Germany or Italy. Yet Icelands startling progress, likened to that of Leicester City back in the Premier League, at their first major tournament has left the French wary before the teams eagerly anticipated meeting.
results.webTitle: France are wary after Iceland victory over England – Bacary Sagna

results.firPara: Nani has warned Manchester United that his former club may live to regret their failure to sign Renato Sanches. They were linked with the 18‑year‑old midfield prodigy from Benfica, having scouted him extensively, but they eventually stepped aside and Bayern Munich made the decisive move.
results.secPara: The Bundesliga club paid an initial £27.5m to secure Sanches on 10 May and the fee could rise to £63m with performance-related add-ons. If he continues to play as he did for Portugal in their Euro 2016 quarter-final victory over Poland on Thursday night, then Benfica will hit the jackpot. So, in a different sense, will Bayern and Portugal.
results.webTitle: Manchester United may rue missing out on Renato Sanches, says Nani
